attributes.action: ask for a review on Taxation for Multiple Home Ownership
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
I would like to ask that property developers/magnets/private landlords with multiple homes - many of which own 100's of homes are taxed heavily on the number of homes owned, with this increasing over certain levels - surely this would encourage them to release these homes back to the market.  

Also the revenue generated by this taxing could possibly help fund Local Authority home building, and would also ensure that the number of new homes to be built would be drastically reduced.

The tireless building of apartment blocks would be reduced - this country needs homes with gardens and space for our children to play, for communities to grow and flourish - not thousands of empty flats.

Surely this move during this turbulent time in our housing market would help the market to correct itself once and for all.

rejection.details:
This petition overlaps with several already in existence:

http://petitions.number10.gov.uk/IVFGenderLaw/
reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
